    • executeQueryAsync

      public void executeQueryAsync(Consumer<CachedRowSet> callback)
      The `executeQueryAsync` method asynchronously executes a query and calls a callback function with the result in a CachedRowSet.
      Parameters:
      callback - The `callback` parameter is a `Consumer` functional interface that accepts a `CachedRowSet` as input. It is used to handle the result of the asynchronous query execution.

    • executeUpdateAsync

      public void executeUpdateAsync()
      The `executeUpdateAsync` method calls `executeQueryOrUpdateAsync` with a null parameter and a flag set to true.

    • setQuery

      public MySQLQueryBuilder setQuery(String qry)
      The `setQuery` function in Java sets the query string and returns the MySQLQueryBuilder object for method chaining.
      Parameters:
      qry - The `qry` parameter in the `setQuery` method is a String that represents the SQL query that you want to set for the MySQL query builder.
      Returns:
      The `MySQLQueryBuilder` object is being returned.

    • addParameter

      public MySQLQueryBuilder addParameter(Object obj)
      The `addParameter` function in a MySQL query builder class adds a parameter to the list of parameters and returns the instance of the query builder for method chaining.
      Parameters:
      obj - The `addParameter` method in the `MySQLQueryBuilder` class is used to add a parameter to the list of parameters stored in the `params` field of the `MySQLQueryBuilder` instance. The method takes an `Object` as a parameter and adds it to the list of parameters.
      Returns:
      The `MySQLQueryBuilder` object is being returned.

    • addParameters

      public MySQLQueryBuilder addParameters(Collection<Object> objects)
      The `addParameters` method in a MySQL query builder class adds a collection of objects as parameters and returns the instance for method chaining.
      Parameters:
      objects - The `addParameters` method in the `MySQLQueryBuilder` class takes a `Collection` of `Object` as input. It adds all the elements in the input `Collection` to the `params` list of the `MySQLQueryBuilder` instance and then returns the updated `MySQLQueryBuilder` instance.
      Returns:
      The `MySQLQueryBuilder` object is being returned.
